rows.PARTICIPANT UX JOURNEY: The full experience from first touch to fully onboarded. Designed like a customer journey.
Every participant IS a customer. The product they're buying is the career opportunity.
Their experience must be as carefully designed as a D2C customer journey.
If the UX sucks, the best people leave. If the UX is exceptional, word spreads.
The journey: They watch a video → they watch a bunch of videos because
they've been pulled into our world → they went through a Dan Crowley funnel
→ they applied → MC conversation → they're in → they're onboarded
→ they're producing → they're on the cast page → they tell others.

rows.col_3: See a short video or social post about the system. MC explaining something from their domain. Or Nilo on a podcast. Or a lead magnet shared by someone they respect.
rows.col_4: "Huh, this is interesting. What is this?"
rows.col_5: YouTube, Twitter, LinkedIn, Reddit, podcast, forwarded link
rows.col_6: Content must be genuinely good. Not salesy. Not desperate. Interesting enough to click.

rows.col_3: Watch 3-5 MC conversations. See the cast page. See the system in action. Read the thesis. Download the lead magnet for their domain.
rows.col_4: "These people are doing something real. This is unlike anything I've seen."
rows.col_5: Password-protected site, MC video library, lead magnet landing page
rows.col_6: Site must be consumer-grade. Videos must be cinematic. The feel must be: if Apple made a company launch tracker.

rows.col_3: Receive 5-7 emails. Each one adds value and context. See daily updates from the MC. Watch the cast page grow. See new conversations posted.
rows.col_4: "I keep thinking about this. I want to be part of it."
rows.col_5: Email sequence, daily site updates, social content
rows.col_6: Emails must be personal and valuable, not generic drip. Each one should be worth reading on its own.

rows.col_3: Fill out a simple form. Not a job application. A "tell us about yourself" form. Upload portfolio or LinkedIn.
rows.col_4: "This was easy. They respect my time."
rows.col_6: Form must be short, mobile-friendly, and feel premium. No 47-field enterprise application.

rows.col_3: Recorded conversation with the MC. Not an interview. A real conversation. MC is genuinely curious. Asks about their work, their interests, their ambitions.
rows.col_4: "That was the best 'interview' I've ever had. I actually enjoyed it."
rows.col_6: MC must be warm, curious, prepared. Must feel like talking to a friend, not a recruiter.

rows.col_3: PM co-founder reviews. Nilo approves. Offer sent within 48 hrs. Contract ready. Clear scope. Clear equity. Clear timeline.
rows.col_4: "They moved fast. They're organized. They know what they want."
rows.col_6: Speed matters. Best candidates have other options. 48 hrs max from MC conversation to offer.

rows.col_3: Welcome email. Site password. Cluster assignment. Contract signed. First MC conversation: "Welcome to the cast." Photo taken for cast page.
rows.col_4: "I'm in. I know exactly what to do. I feel like I belong."
rows.col_5: Welcome email, Slack access, site access, MC conversation
rows.col_6: First 24 hrs must be PERFECT. Tools set up. Expectations clear. They feel welcomed, not lost.

rows.col_3: MC records 2-3 conversations about their scope. They read their P- tab (project plan). They start producing. Daily standup with PM co-founder.
rows.col_4: "This is well-organized. I know what 'done' looks like. The MC conversations help me think."
rows.col_5: P- tab, C- tab, MC conversations, daily standup
rows.col_6: No ambiguity. Every question they have should already be answered in their project plan.

rows.col_3: They're working. MC checks in regularly. PM co-founder tracks milestones. Expert reviewers provide feedback. Their work is visible on the site.
rows.col_4: "My work matters. People see it. It's becoming real."
rows.col_5: V- tab progress, site updates, MC check-ins
rows.col_6: Progress must be visible. Milestones celebrated. Blockers resolved fast.

rows.col_3: Their photo and bio go on the cast page. MC introduces them in a daily update. They're publicly part of the project.
rows.col_4: "My name is on this. People can see I'm part of it. This is my career artifact."
rows.col_6: Cast page must be cinematic. Real portraits. Real bios. Feels like credits of a film.
